Class Animation

java.lang.Object
Animation
public class Animation extends Object
Animation class to handle the loading and displaying of animated sprites.

This class is responsible for loading frames from a specified directory, scaling them to a specified size, and displaying them in a JLabel. It uses a Timer to change frames periodically.

Example Use: 
 
    JLabel label = new JLabel();
    Animation animation = new Animation("path/to/frames/", 10, 100, label);
    animation.start(120);

  • Constructor Details

    • Animation

      public Animation(String root, int numFrames, int frameDelay, JLabel imageLabel)
      Constructor for the Animation class.

      Creates an instance of the Animation class with the specified image path, number of frames, frame delay, and JLabel to display the animation.
      Parameters:
      root - The path to the directory containing the frames
      numFrames - The number of frames in the animation
      frameDelay - The delay between frames in milliseconds
      imageLabel - The JLabel to display the animation

  • Method Details

    • start

      public void start()
      Starts the animation with the default size of 120 pixels.

    • start

      public void start(int size)
      Starts the animation with a specified size.
      Parameters:
      size - The size of the animation in pixels

    • startAnimation

      protected void startAnimation(JLabel imageLabel, ArrayList<String> frames, int interval, int size)
      Starts the animation.

      Initializes a timer that periodically updates a JLabel with the next frame in the animation, scaled to a certain size, every n seconnds.
      Parameters:
      imageLabel - The JLabel to display the animation
      frames - The ArrayList of frame paths
      interval - The delay between frames in milliseconds (n)
      size - The size to scale the frames to

    • restart

      public void restart()
      Restarts the timer

    • updateAnimation

      public void updateAnimation(BufferedImage image)
      Changes the animation to a static image, until restarted.

      This method stops the timer and sets the JLabel to display a static image. It is used when we want to change the sprite of the pet to reflect a certain state.
      Parameters:
      image - The image to display.
